videoSnippet.title: Outspeeding the Speed Demon || MVL vs Nakamura || GCT Cote d’Ivoire (2019)

Maxime Vachier-Lagrave vs Hikaru Nakamura
Grand Chess Tour Cote d棚voire (Blitz) (2019), Abidjan CIV, rd 3, May-11 
Spanish Game: Berlin Defense. l'Hermet Variation Berlin Wall Defense (C67) 

1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 Nf6 4. O-O Ne4 5. d4 Nd6 6. Bc6 dc6 7. de5 Nf5 8. Qd8 Kd8 9. h3 Ke8 10. Nc3 h5 11. Bf4 Be7 12. Rad1 Be6 13. Ng5 Rh6 14. Rfe1 Bb4 15. a3 Bc3 16. bc3 h4 17. Ne4 Rg6 18. g4 hg3 19. fg3 Ne7 20. h4 Nd5 21. Bg5 Bf5 22. h5 Nc3 23. hg6 Nd1 24. Kg2 Bg6 25. Nc5 b6 26. Na6 Rc8 27. Rd1 Bc2 28. Nc7 Kf8 29. Rd8 Rd8 30. Bd8 Bd3 31. Kf3 Bc4 32. g4 Bf1 33. g5 Bd3 34. Ke3 Bf1 35. g6 Bh3 36. gf7 Kf7 37. Bg5 Bc8 38. Kd4 Bd7 39. Ke4 Bc8 40. Kf4 Bd7 41. Na6 Ke6 42. Ke4 Bc8 43. Nb4 c5 44. Na2 Bb7 45. Kf4 b5 46. Nc1 Kd5 47. Be7 a5 48. Nb3 c4 49. Na5 Bc8 50. Bb4 g5 51. Kg5 Ke5 52. Nc6 Ke4 53. Kf6 Kd3 54. Ne5 Kd4 55. Nc6 Kd3 56. Ke5 c3 57. Nd4 c2 58. Nb3 Kc4 59. Nc1 Bg4 60. Kf4 Bh5 61. Ke3 Bg6 62. Kd2 Bf5 63. Ne2 Bg6 64. Kc1 Bd3 65. Nf4 Bf5 66. Ng2 Bg6 67. Ne3 Kd4 68. Ng4 Bf5 69. Nf6 Ke5 70. Ne8 Kd5 71. Kb2 Kc6 72. Ng7 Be4 73. Bd2 Kd6 74. Kc3 Bg6 75. Kd4 Ke7 76. Ke5 Bh7 77. Ne6 Kd7 78. Nd4 Bd3 79. Kd5 Bc4 80. Kc5 Bd3 81. Kb4 Kd6 82. Kc3 Bg6 83. Nb5 Kc5 84. a4 Kb6 85. Kb4 Ka6 86. a5 Be4 87. Nc7 Kb7 88. Ne6 Bf5 89. Nc5 Kc6 90. Be3 Bh7 91. Nb3 Kb7 92. Bf4 Ka6 93. Nc5 Ka7 94. Kb5 Bf5 95. a6 Bh3 96. Ka5 Bf1 97. Be3 Be2 98. Ne6 Kb8

The Côte d’Ivoire Rapid & Blitz is the 1st stage of the 2019 Grand Chess Tour, with World Champion Magnus Carlsen heading a 10-player field that features 7 tour regulars and wild cards Wei Yi, Veselin Topalov and Bassem Amin. The event takes place in the Pullman Abidjan Hotel in Abidjan, Ivory Coast from May 8-12 and has a $150,000 prize fund.

The rapid section is a single round-robin with 3 rounds each day on the first 3 days. The time control is 25 minutes for all moves and a 10-second delay from move 1. The final 2 days are a blitz double round-robin, with 18 rounds of 5 minutes + 3-second delay blitz. Rapid games count double, with 2 points for a win and 1 for a draw. 

Official website: grandchesstour.org/2019-grand-chess-tour/2019-Cote-dIvoire-Rapid-Blitz
